item.title: How to Consolidate Data of tho sheets in OpenOffice Calc
item.description: Preview of the required Document for this question
item.content:encoded:
Preview of the required Document for this question​

Answer​

The steps are as follows:​

Step 1​

Open a new file in OpenOffice Calc and write the following data :

Step 2​

Open another file in OpenOffice Calc and write the following Data.

Step 3​

Open the third sheet and click on Data → Consolidate. The following dialog box appears.

Step 4​

Click to select the Source data range of the first sheet and then click on Add button.

Step 5​

After ranging from both sheets, the dialog box will appear.

Step 6​

Click on the green button and select the Cell where you want the consolidated data.

Step 7​

After adding the range and selecting the cell where we want the result, click on the OK button.

Step 8​

After clicking the OK button, we will get the consolidated data as shown below.

Congratulations​

We Have Successfully Solved Our Question. Stay With Us For Next Solutions

Edit the file​

Click on this button to Preview and Edit the file of this question.

item.title: Welcome
item.description: Docusaurus blogging features are powered by the blog plugin.
item.content:encoded:
Docusaurus blogging features are powered by the blog plugin.

Simply add Markdown files (or folders) to the blog directory.

Regular blog authors can be added to authors.yml.

The blog post date can be extracted from filenames, such as:

  • 2019-05-30-welcome.md
  • 2019-05-30-welcome/index.md

A blog post folder can be convenient to co-locate blog post images:

The blog supports tags as well!

And if you don't want a blog: just delete this directory, and use blog: false in your Docusaurus config.

item.title: MDX Blog Post
item.description: Blog posts support Docusaurus Markdown features, such as MDX.
item.content:encoded:
Blog posts support Docusaurus Markdown features, such as MDX.

tip

Use the power of React to create interactive blog posts.

<button onClick={() => alert('button clicked!')}>Click me!</button>

item.title: Long Blog Post
item.description: This is the summary of a very long blog post,
item.content:encoded:
This is the summary of a very long blog post,

Use a <!-- truncate --> comment to limit blog post size in the list view.
